line-7: Key Vacancy Information: Job Title: Senior Project Engineer (Process & Assurance) Role Type: Full Time, Permanent Location: York George Stephenson House Closing date: 19th December 2023 Salary: salary starting at £55,596 and increasing to £62,546 (plus Employee Healthcare) Annual Leave: 28 days + bank holidays Hours: 35 per week *Employees will be entitled to a 75% discount off leisure, this includes all Advance, off peak and super off peak tickets* About Network Rail: Network Rail has played a key role in keeping the country moving during the coronavirus pandemic – and we will play an equally important part in rebuilding from it. line-9: As part of the Regional Engineering function, you will actively support the delivery of the Safety and Assurance Accountability of the DEAM function. This will require you to take an active role in conducting second line assurance of engineering activities within the Structures discipline across all functions (where required). You will seek opportunities within engineering controls, standards, and procedures to bring about improvements in safety, quality and cost effectiveness of design, maintenance, construction, commissioning amongst other technical activities on relevant projects and initiatives within the region.
line-11: Key Accountabilities –1. Undertake second line assurance (including audits) of engineering activities within the regional asset portfolio to assess compliance with Rail Group and Network Rail company standards and effectiveness of project and engineering control procedures.2. Identify opportunities and support the implementation of improvements in engineering controls, standards, and procedures applicable to the structures discipline.3. Support the mentoring and competence development of engineering resources working on projects within the discipline and provide functional guidance, direction and deliver briefings.4. Drive the embedment of industry practice within the structures discipline.5. Undertake assurance on the application of relevant techniques and procedures of quantified and qualitative risk assessment.6. Undertake assurance on environmental aspects of projects in accordance with Network Rail environmental policies.7. Conduct audits on contractors to monitor safety, quality of designs, maintenance, construction testing and commissioning and the adequacy of management systems.8. Provide technical advice by undertaking or support accident and incident investigations with the view to enable the monitoring, implementation, and embedment of arising actions and closure of any recommendations.9. Support the setting of policy and standards, and process updates within the Structures discipline by proactive research and respond to changes in internal and external requirements and practice that may impact the discipline.10. Assist the Principal Engineer with the implementation and management of competence and training within the discipline.11. Act as Delivery Manager for specific projects of portfolio of projects and deliver to cost, quality and time.12. Support technical inputs into enhancement of existing standards, specifications, and system risk management by undertaking engineering analysis to support derogations and risk assessment techniques, where non-compliances are identified.13. Support the development of discipline strategies around capability, assurance, and technology with support from industry partners and relevant stakeholders.14. Proactively research and respond to changes in the internal and external requirements and practice which impact upon policy and standards.15. Support Engineering Verification activities.16. Integrate and co-ordinate activity across different engineering disciplines and contribute to the development of engineers within the practice. Essential· Significant experience in the structures engineering discipline, ideally with involvement in construction and design projects across multi discipline areas· Technical qualifications to at least HNC level or equivalent in a relevant subject· Membership of a relevant professional institution· Broad technical engineering experience· Experience of contracting· Project or financial planning and management experience.· Knowledge of structuring safety cases in support of projects· An understanding of safety management systems, quality assurance and risk assessment techniques· Understanding of the arrangements required for the independent assessment of works· Experience of undertaking engineering quality assurance.· Accident or incident investigation experience. Desirable· Chartered status of equivalent in a relevant engineering discipline· Membership of a relevant professional institution· Experience of applying structured continuous improvement techniques· Proven ability in managing commercial, contractual, and financial issues.· Knowledge of the railway industry and understanding of the railway infrastructure.· Experience of applying structured continuous improvement techniques (for e.g. Six Sigma Yellow Belt)
